intro: Raphanus sativus var. nonpinnatus, commonly known as the bulbous radish, is a cultivated variety of the radish plant characterized by its swollen, underground root. This plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is native to Asia, though it is now widely grown around the world. The bulbous root is the primary edible part, typically harvested when it is young and tender. It has a crisp texture and a slightly spicy, peppery flavor, similar to other radish varieties. The plant grows quickly, often reaching maturity within a few weeks, making it a popular choice for home gardens and commercial cultivation.
